required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pulmonary Function Test Study - Automated Interpretation
clinical_study.official_title: Pulmonary Function Test Study - Automated Interpretation

brief_summary.textblock: A multicentric study to explore variability when clinicians are intrepreting lung function tests. Comparison with results of in-house built software for automatic interpretation.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a multi-center non-interventional retrospective study that will use data obtained from clinical routine. In the hospital, subjects with or without respiratory complaints undergo subset of (or complete) pulmonary function tests if clinically indicated. Results of these tests, expressed as numerical values are send to the clinical workstation (KWS) for immediate clinical use. These results are subsequently being interpreted by a clinician.
A random sample of 50 lung function printouts of subjects followed at the Leuven pulmonary service with a final diagnosis of a respiratory disease have been randomised. These anonymized printouts will be given to different pulmonologists for examination in 18 different centers and compared with the interpretation of in-house developed software.

primary_outcome.measure: Interclass correlation coëfficiënt for whole group
primary_outcome.description: Variation in preferred primary diagnosis of respiratory disease given by every physician for every case (selection of one diagnosis out of a fixed panel of 9 possible diagnoses).

secondary_outcome.measure: Interclass correlation coëfficiënt for every case
secondary_outcome.description: Variation in preferred primary diagnosis of respiratory disease given by every physician for an individual case (selection of one diagnosis out of a fixed panel of 9 possible diagnoses).

secondary_outcome.measure: Accuracy of physicians expressed as a percentage of correct diagnoses per case (%)
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of diagnostic labels per case provided by the physicians with gold standard diagnosis based on clinical characteristics, complete pulmonary function test data and all other investigations (CT scan, biochmestry, functional test, biopsy, etc...) needed to come to a gold standard diagnosis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Accuracy of physicans expressed as a percentage of correct diagnoses in total group (%)
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of diagnostic labels per case provided by the physicians with gold standard diagnosis based on clinical characteristics, complete pulmonary function test data and all other investigations (CT scan, biochmestry, functional test, biopsy, etc...) needed to come to a gold standard diagnosis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Accuracy of physicians expressed as a percentage of correct diagnoses per hospital (group) (%)
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of diagnostic labels per case provided by the group of physicians per hospital with gold standard diagnosis based on clinical characteristics, complete pulmonary function test data and all other investigations (CT scan, biochmestry, functional test, biopsy, etc...) needed to come to a gold standard diagnosis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Accuracy of software expressed as a percentage of correct diagnoses in total group, per hospital and per case
secondary_outcome.description: Comparing labels of in-house developed software for the clinical interpretation and diagnostic labeling of complete pulmonary function tests with GOLD standard based on all additional tests

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of accuracy (% of correct diagnoses) of physicians with software
secondary_outcome.description: Comparing the diagnostic labels provided by in-house developed software for the clinical interpretation and diagnostic labeling of complete pulmonary function tests with those of physicans (in total group, per hospital and per case)

study_pop.textblock: Subjects with or without respiratory complaints undergo subset of (or complete) pulmonary function tests

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age more than 18 years
2. Completed one or more pulmonary function tests
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Younger than 18
2. Lung transplantation, lung cancer.
